result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Atty Corey Mehlos is authorized to appear on behalf of Defn
Demand for Discovery filed by Atty Corey Mehlos

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lacy M. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

8:36 AM Defendant Dillon J Johnson in court.  Attorney Corey Mehlos in court for Dillon J Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:51 AM Defendant Dillon J Johnson not in court.  Attorney Corey Mehlos not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victims. Court noted letter from defense requesting adjournment. State did not object nor request warrant. No statement by victim. Court rescheduled Initial Appearance.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
